items.text: full, right up there on middle and leg, front-foot defence
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: gets down for an ill-advised sweep to a slower one that gives him no room, gets a top-edge that lands in the region just behind square leg
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: punched to wide long-on
items.shortText: Chahal to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: flights it up generously on leg, Mushfiqur makes room and drives wide of long-off
items.shortText: Chahal to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: slants a full one across his off-stump, driven wide of extra cover
items.shortText: Chahal to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: flat length ball, tucked behind square to short fine
items.shortText: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: pitched up on off, driven to long-off. Jaddu oversteps
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, (no ball) 1 run

items.preText: the umpire calls this a dead ball as Jadeja is in his delivery stride. Was there an extra fielder outside? It was a full toss that was punched to mid-off. Anyway, he'll have to go at it again
items.text: so the extra ball proves costly. A wide length ball, Shakib blasts it through the covers
items.shortText: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.preText: Shashank says that the confusion was because Rohit wanted to reset the field, but Jadeja had already bowled before he could.
items.text: gets down to sweep from outside off through square leg, DK runs across from deep midwicket but dives too early
items.shortText: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: that's poor.. shoddy batting from Shakib. Goes for a repeat of the previous delivery but this one's not full enough. A length ball outside off, swept straight into the hands of square leg for a tame end
items.postText:
Right. Three spinners, so we're keeping our stints short and sweet. Over to Al.

Thanks, Akshay. Anybody else wondering if Bangladesh become a little too gung-ho when they face India? As if trying to prove to the entire world that they can dominate this team?
items.shortText: Jadeja to Shakib Al Hasan, OUT

dismissal.text: Shakib Al Hasan c Dhawan b Jadeja 17 (12b 3x4 0x6) SR: 141.66

items.text: full and outside off, he drives past mid-off
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: jams his bat down on a very full delivery on off stump to pick up a single at long-off
items.postText: More insight from Shashank: Shakib threw his wicket away, playing a shot in anger. Clearly unhappy at the small turn of events - the confusion that led to umpires intervening. Tends to lose his concentration very easily. Dhawan moved to square leg after the sweep. Shakib looked to go midwicket, but ended up dragging it straight to square leg.
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Parth Gulati: "The biggest competition right now is between India and Pakistan - whose over rate is better?" --- With 30+ overs of spin expected here, it's going to be tight! Here's Kuldeep with a leg gully
items.text: loops it up temptingly outside off, but Mushfiqur keeps his head and defends
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: a little too generous with the flight this time and Mushfiqur deals with a full toss capably, driving it to long-on
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: lures the drive away from the body with the line of this googly (?) well outside off. Mithun pokes to cover
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: pushes into the leg side, with the turn
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: shifts back seeing the length just a touch short and dabs to short third man
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: dangerous to sweep right off the stumps, but Mushfiqur does it well, head over the ball, wrists rolling on it to keep it down to long leg
items.postText: The last time Jadeja took an ODi wicket was also against Bangaldesh in the Champions Trophy and that was also Shakib. And it came about after MS Dhoni went up to tell Rohit Sharma to put a man at square leg for the sweep
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: eases it through the covers
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: looks to slice what is effectively a wide yorker but ends up missing it
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: good length ball on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: flat, quick and wide - perfect ingredients for a smoking hot cut shot - but Mushfiqur finds point
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: shifts back to nudge the length ball on leg stump through midwicket. Can't beat the field, and Jadeja, rushing across to field the ball, may have dome some damage to Mushfiqur's leg
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: rocks back to push through the covers
items.postText: prabhu: "44 is decent score in PPs, also 3 wickets is decent bowling in PPs."
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: huge appeal for lbw with Mushfiqur playing a half-hearted sweep. It's a smidge too full for the shot - he doesn't even get down on bended knee for it. Ball might not have hit leg stump. Umpire Brathwaite makes the call and Dhoni doesn't challenge it
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mohammad Mithun, no run
